summary: This is a domestic witness travel request form from the SDNY Victim/Witness Unit, dated November 12, 2021, for a fact witness to appear in the trial of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The witness is scheduled to travel to New York for trial preparation on December 7, 2021, and for trial testimony on December 8-9, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the travel request (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, Docket No. 20 Cr. 330).

persons.name: Ed Tyrrell
persons.context: Mentioned in the instructions as a contact for questions regarding witness travel funding for investigative interviews.

events.title: Witness Trial Preparation
events.description: A fact witness is scheduled to appear in the SDNY at 9 AM for trial preparation in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Witness Trial Testimony
events.description: A fact witness is scheduled to appear all day for trial testimony in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Witness Trial Testimony
events.description: A fact witness is scheduled to appear all day for trial testimony in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: The document is a formal travel request for a fact witness to testify in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, Docket No. 20 Cr. 330).
The witness is not a victim-witness, not facing criminal charges, and resides within the continental United States.
The witness's travel was scheduled from December 6, 2021 (evening arrival) to December 9, 2021 (evening departure), with court appearances on December 7-9, 2021.
The form references standard DOJ procedures for witness travel, including instructions to consult Ed Tyrrell for questions about funding for investigative interview travel.
